about.title: About
about.paragraph1: Did you want to create your own universe or become a legendary hero?
about.paragraph2: Find the right team, take on the role of Game Master or player, and start exploring!

master.title: Master
master.paragraph1: Create your own universe based on your preferences. Each world should have its own story, global plot, and characters.
master.paragraph2: The local storyline will be tied to the players. And only you have the right to limit, punish and encourage them.

player.title: Player
player.paragraph1: Become whoever you want (within the universe), describe your character, act on the script or act against it.

lobby.title: Room List
lobby.noRoomsCreated: No one has created a room yet üîç

translator.title: Translation
translator.paragraph1: The translation only includes UI texts.
translator.paragraph2: Custom messages and titles will not be translated!

040.listItem1: Added support for variables for value in the action editor
040.listItem3: Added a modal window with a list of changes versions ¬´Changelog¬ª (Yes, this is it)

035.listItem2: Added self-interaction capability when performing an action in the ¬´BattleField¬ª window
035.listItem4: Removed blur effect on overlay windows

enterPasswordRoom.title: Joining a room
enterPasswordRoom.paragraph: Enter the password to enter the room.

confirmLeaveRoom.title: Leave the room
confirmLeaveRoom.paragraph1: You are already in the room:
confirmLeaveRoom.paragraph2: Are you sure you want to leave the room and join the other one?

restorePassword.title: Restore password
restorePassword.paragraph1: Enter a verified email address associated with your account and we will send an email with a code to it.
restorePassword.paragraph2: Enter the recovery code from the email.
restorePassword.paragraph3: Enter a new password and try not to forget it again.

saveGame.title: Saving the game
saveGame.description: Saving characters, dummies, documents and chat history in JSON format.

loadGame.title: Download the game
loadGame.description: Upload a JSON file. To upload characters, dummies, documents and chat history.

paragraph1.title: Welcome!
paragraph1.text1: Here you can learn more about the available mechanics on our site.
paragraph1.text2: All available tools are in the left menu:

paragraph2.title: Dice Roll
paragraph2.text1: The dice roll takes place in the right side panel of the chat room.
paragraph2.text2: This action can be performed using a command or by pressing the necessary button.

paragraph3.title: Saving and loading the game
paragraph3.text1: At the end of the game session, we recommend saving all your progress. Since the room is deleted automatically after 12 hours of inactivity in it.
paragraph3.text2: The game is loaded manually in the corresponding side menu item.

paragraph4.title: Characters and dummies
paragraph4.text1: Character ‚Äî is an object controlled by the participants of the room. It is used to monitor the state (section ¬´Characters¬ª) and conduct combat operations (section ¬´Battlefield¬ª).
paragraph4.text2: Dummy ‚Äî is an object controlled by the participants of the room. It is an ordinary mob, which was created by the Host or the player to conduct combat (the ¬´Battlefield¬ª section).

paragraph1.title: Bars settings
paragraph1.text1: One of the important components of any D&D event: setting up possible states for your imaginary creatures.
paragraph1.text2: This option is located in the menu item ¬´Room Settings¬ª. Since this mechanism will be applied to characters and dummies.
paragraph1.text3: And so! You have decided what states all creatures will have, given a name, selected a color and pressed the save button. Now all existing characters and dummies will have these bars!

paragraph1.title: Window ¬´Characters¬ª
paragraph1.text1: A strong, clever intellectual, or maybe a weak, clumsy fool?
paragraph1.text2: You can set possible specials for the characters in the settings that are located in the header of this window.
paragraph1.text3: In the same place you can change the effects: name, icon, type (it's just a color) and description.
paragraph1.text4: At the moment, the effects are a common reminder for players.

paragraph2.title: Character creating
paragraph2.text1: It's time for players to create their own game avatar:
paragraph2.listItem1: 1. In the ¬´Characters¬ª window, go to creation.
paragraph2.listItem2: 2. Assign the level of your hero (suddenly you are the master's favorite).
paragraph2.listItem3: 3. Choose an avatar from the available options.
paragraph2.listItem4: 4. In the first block, you can give a name and a description to your character.
paragraph2.listItem5: 5. The second block contains all available bars, their current and maximum values.
paragraph2.listItem6: 6. In the third block we assign characteristics.
paragraph2.listItem7: 7. Next is a block with character effects.
paragraph2.listItem8: 8. And finally: an action editor that will allow interaction between creatures on the battlefield (the ¬´Battlefield¬ª section).

paragraph3.title: Character editing
paragraph3.text1: You can edit all the displayed values in the character cards or go into full editing.

paragraph1.title: Window ¬´Battlefield¬ª
paragraph1.text1: ¬´Battlefield¬ª animates a combat system that uses prescribed actions of creatures. In addition, you can create dummies templates and add them to the battlefield.
paragraph1.text2: In the upper part there are the master's dummies.
paragraph1.text3: At the bottom are the characters and the dummies of the players.
paragraph1.text4: Each character and dummy has actions that you can customize: name, description and target. Action has a target bar and an applied value to it. In the future, these actions will be displayed on the creature's card on the battlefield.

paragraph2.title: Dummy creating
paragraph2.text1: In order to add a dummy to the battlefield, you need to create its template. Its construction is almost identical to character creation. The blank contains: an avatar, general information, the maximum value of bars, turning on/off the bar and an action editor.
paragraph2.text2: After successfully creating a template, you will have its card on which you can also: update all the displayed information, go into full editing, add a dummy and delete all its instances from the battlefield.

paragraph3.title: How does the interaction happen?
paragraph3.text1: The character cards and the added dummies are now displayed on your board:
paragraph3.text2: Let's get started! The card consists of a name, an avatar, a button for calling actions, there are creature bars under the avatar, and dummies also have a specific deletion.
paragraph3.text3: Next, we call the list of actions at the bottom of the card and select the necessary. The action can be applied to a creature, to yourself, or canceled:

paragraph1.title: Window ¬´Text Editor¬ª
paragraph1.text1: In this window you can write some notes, quests, plot, inventory accounting, etc.
paragraph1.text2: To create a document, you need:
paragraph1.listItem1: 1. Go to the list of documents in the upper left corner of this window.
paragraph1.listItem2: 2. Give a description of the document and click the check mark, thereby we create it for all participants of the room.
paragraph1.listItem3: 3. Next, you can click on the + button in this card to make the document appear in your list.
paragraph1.listItem4: 4. Go back and click on the required document.
paragraph1.text3: The document is edited in live mode.

windowBattlefield.kill: Do you want to kill me?

actions.kill: Remove copies of the dummy from the field

notification.fileVerifiedSuccess: The file has been successfully checked for validity
